metadata.dc:author: del Río Martín, J V
Sarasa Corral, J L
Gómez Navarro, E
Melero Calleja, E
metadata.dc:description: Recently, a new class of colorectal polyps has been described. Because of their histological characteristics, they have been called inflammatory myoglandular polyps. We report the case of a forty years old male, in haemodialysis for six years, who noticed the growth of an anal tumour. It is the first description of one of them placed in the distal part of the rectum.
metadata.dc:title: Pólipo inflamatorio mioglandular localizado en el extremo distal del recto.
[Myoglandular inflammatory polyp located in the distal end of the rectum].
metadata.dc:publisher: Revista espanola de enfermedades digestivas : organo oficial de la Sociedad Espanola de Patologia Digestiva
